item.title: Ticket #1003 (Some template tags add "h2", some don't) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1003 (Some template tags add "h2", some don't) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
Some template tags, such as "get_links_list" automatically insert "h2" tags on the titles with no way to override. Other template tags, like "wp_list_cats" do not.

All template tags that return a title should be consistent and allow the title to be overridden, even allowing no title to be displayed.

item.title: Ticket #988 (warning returned in mw_newPost) updated
item.dc:creator: michel v
item.description:
More proper fix would be to change "if ($catnames)" into "if (is_array($catnames))", since checking twice is useless. Lines 526 and 579 want this fix.

Why the error occurs: WP receives a post with no categories, and tries to loop through the categories.

item.title: Ticket #901 (apply_filters's handling of extra arguments is broken) updated
item.dc:creator: michel v
item.description:
Uploaded a version of the patch that doesn't handle the :X addition.

So, long story short: to accept more than one argument, one must specify a fourth argument to add_filter() and add_action().

item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1001 (New php-gettext, speed up WordPress l10n) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: As described here ​http://wordpress.org/support/topic.php?id=25561 a new version of php-gettext is available: ​https://savannah.nongnu.org/projects/php-gettext/ It speeds up rendering when using localization. I'd love to have that in WordPress 1.5.1.

item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
I feel special.

item.title: Ticket #1000 (Text doesnt wrap for <Previous Entry> <Next Entry> links at top of template) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1000 (Text doesnt wrap for <Previous Entry> <Next Entry> links at top of template) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
​http://www.alexking.org/software/wordpress/themes/blog/2005/02/27/theme-competition/

In that link, as you can see, the previous and next links ( Â« WordPress 1.5 Released with Theme Support Theme Competition Rules Â» are not on the same line.

IMHO, this does not look very nice.

I'd say the expected behavior would be for each entry (previous, next) to wrap to a new line, instead of extending past it's border, and making the next entry go to the next line.

item.title: Ticket #980 (wp-register.php not sending email) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
function wp_mail($to, $subject, $message, $headers = ) {

if( $headers == ) {

$headers = "From: " . get_settings('admin_email') . "\n";

}

this worked for me.

item.title: Ticket #972 (No "save and continue editing" for pages) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
No, that's not what I mean. I missed 0000657 on my pass through mosquito, but this is not a duplicate of 0000485. I am not talking about a draft. I am talking about publishing the page, but being able to make more changes immmediately. This is analagous to regular word processing and saving the document regularly.

I don't understand why this can't be done, as all it would require is a normal save with an added redirect back to the page in question's edit screen.

item.dc:creator: kim
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #992 (bloginfo_rss() is dropping its argument) created
item.dc:creator: kim
item.description:
The bloginfo_rss() function is not passing its argument to get_bloginfo_rss(). This means that no matter what was asked for, the name of the blog is returned.

Patch attached.

item.title: Ticket #991 (timer_stop() does not consider precision if not in display mode) created

item.description: If display parameter is false then the timer_stop() function returns the current time without taking into consideration the precision parameter.
